Supervisar, medir y analizar los indicadores clave de rendimiento (KPI), las métricas y otros datos. Desarrollar informes, presentaciones, casos de negocio, para apoyar la toma de decisiones basada en datos. Trabajar estrechamente con las partes interesadas dentro del departamento para comprender sus necesidades de análisis de datos. Desarrollar o apoyar la implantación de sistemas y herramientas para agilizar el proceso de recogida de datos y facilitar la toma de decisiones. Analizar los procesos existentes para impulsar iniciativas de mejora continua basadas en el análisis y la información de los datos disponibles. Trabajar estrechamente con los grupos de contabilidad, proyectos, regulación y otros grupos dentro de la organización para apoyar los casos de negocio, el análisis de la planificación estratégica y la mejora continua del negocio y la presentación de informes. Registre información sobre los cultivos, como el uso de pesticidas, el uso de aceite hortícola, los rendimientos, el crecimiento de las plantas o los costos. Participar en la inspección, clasificación, almacenamiento y tratamiento post-cosecha de los cultivos. Plantar, cultivar y cosechar manualmente frutas (incluidas guayabas y bayas), hierbas, verduras (incluidos tomates, pepinos, zanahorias, rábanos, pimientos, acelgas, lechuga, verduras de hoja verde, berenjenas) microgreens y plantas de flores comestibles. Etiquetar, podar, trasplantar, maceta, fertilizar, rociar, propagar y cosechar hojas de arbustos y árboles. Cajas de jardín criadas con malezas y plantas en macetas manualmente y mediante el uso de azadas, llanas, rastrillos y rastrillos manuales. Use herramientas manuales que incluyan rastrillos, rastrillos manuales, herramientas eléctricas (como taladros eléctricos y sierras circulares), martillos, destornilladores, palas, paletas, azadas, podadoras, tijeras, tijeras, carretillas y cuchillos. Utilice equipos agrícolas, incluidos sopladores de hojas, máquina cosechadora, rompebocas, cámara de germinación, minicargador, sistema de riego, bancos de inundación, controles de invernadero / túnel alto, cortadora de césped e deshidratador. Mantener vehículos agrícolas, implementos y equipos mecánicos. Configurar y operar equipos de riego. Informar a los administradores de fincas sobre el progreso de los cultivos. Identificar plantas, plagas y malezas para determinar la selección y aplicación de pesticidas, aceite hortícola y fertilizantes. Operar miniloader y maquinaria autopropulsada para plantar, distribuir suelo, compostar, mantillo y mantener cultivos y terrenos. Cargue productos agrícolas en vehículos. Conducir vehículos al mercado y para entregas a los clientes (este es un deber de trabajo opcional y las licencias pueden ser obtenidas por el trabajador después de llegar para la temporada). Limpie las áreas de trabajo y mantenga los terrenos y el paisajismo. Vender productos agrícolas, plantas y flores a los clientes en los puestos y mercados de la granja. Entregar productos agrícolas, plantas y flores a clientes y mercados. Regular las condiciones del invernadero, y los sistemas de riego interiores y exteriores. Siente las hojas de las plantas y observa su coloración para detectar la presencia de insectos o enfermedades. Proporcionar información y asesoramiento al público sobre la selección, compra y cuidado de los productos. Mantener y reparar equipos, incluidos los sistemas de riego y control de clima. Cavar, cortar y trasplantar plántulas, esquejes, plantas, árboles y arbustos. Mantener el inventario, informando a los gerentes de la escasez según sea necesario. Mueva arbustos, plantas y árboles en contenedores, usando carretilla o minicargador. Ata y agrupa flores, plantas, arbustos, ramas, verduras y árboles. Empaque los productos agrícolas en contenedores y cárguelos para completar pedidos o prepararse para los mercados. Envuelve las raíces de los árboles. Transportar y esparcir tierra, fertilizante, musgo de turba, mantillo y otros materiales para acondicionar el suelo, utilizando carretilla o carro y palas. Repare edificios de granjas, cercas y otras estructuras utilizando las herramientas mencionadas anteriormente. Rocíe y riegue plantas, arbustos, árboles y bandejas de microgreens. Aplique pesticidas de uso general a las plantas (incluyendo frutas, hierbas y verduras), arbustos y árboles. Agregue fertilizante para enmendar el suelo en camas de jardín, macetas y bandejas microverde. Todos los trabajos se realizan al aire libre en el campo, en el invernadero y en túneles altos. Levante y lleve cargas de hasta 50 libras. Lleve a los trabajadores agrícolas a la ciudad para comprar comestibles y hacer mandados (este es un deber de trabajo opcional / las licencias pueden ser obtenidas por el trabajador después de llegar o la temporada).

Valiant Harbor International is a CVE Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business that specializes in technical, program, acquisition, and financial services for Government science and technology, research and development, and technological programs. At Valiant Harbor International, we emphasize intense focus on helping federal government agencies identify and address organizational challenges to tailor and integrate specific solutions to solve their most difficult problems. Success is defined by our ability to meet our customer's needs quickly, efficiently, and effectively-we are a management consulting firm with a successful record of offering a wide range of professional, scientific, and technical services requiring a high degree of expertise and training.

Job Description
Valiant Harbor International is seeking a Mid-Level Program Analyst to support the Office of Naval Research (ONR). This position involves providing business and financial support for the Mathematics, Computers, and Information Sciences Research Division, as well as the Electronics, Sensors, and Network Research Division. The Program Analyst will perform a variety of financial, administrative, and programmatic duties, ensuring the successful execution of ONR-sponsored projects and compliance with government policies.

Job Responsibilities
• Provide business and financial support to Program Officers, ensuring compliance with ONR processes and procedures.
• Assist with planning, forecasting, program budgeting, funding execution, performance monitoring, and reporting.
• Utilize financial systems such as Navy ERP, COBRA, PBIS, and other tools to monitor funding, commitments, obligations, and expenditures.
• Prepare funding documents and assist in resolving discrepancies in funding execution.
• Perform financial analyses to ensure compliance with anti-deficiency laws and other financial regulations.
• Support solicitation and proposal evaluation processes, including administrative coordination and public notifications.
• Conduct Dormant Account Review Quarterly (DARQ) reviews and prepare documentation.
• Maintain calendars, book conference rooms, and coordinate events.
• Provide support for meetings, workshops, and conferences, including preparation of lessons learned and distributing information.
• Assist in building the Program Objective Memorandum (POM) budget and drafting R-2 Exhibits.
• Conduct qualitative and quantitative analyses to recommend program improvements.
• Support leadership with administrative tasks, including travel authorizations, correspondence, and scheduling.
• Manage and maintain ONR's SharePoint site and public website content.
• Support requests for the release of information, ensuring proper approvals are obtained.

Required Skills and Experiences
• Must be a United States citizen.
• Current SECRET Clearance or ability to obtain a SECRET Clearance prior to award.
• Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with five (5) years of business and financial experience supporting the federal government, OR a business/finance-related professional certification with ten (10) years of business and financial experience supporting the federal government.
• Must have two (2) years of recent experience in government planning, forecasting, budgeting, and performance monitoring.
• Must have two (2) years of recent experience working with Navy Funds Management Systems, including Navy Enterprise Resource Planning (Navy ERP), Computer Optimized Batch Reconciliation Application (COBRA), Program Budget Information System (PBIS), Contract and Grant Administration Management Information System (CAMIS), Microsoft Access, and Microsoft SharePoint. Experience with similar DoD systems may be acceptable.
• Experience managing RDT&E funds (Budget Activity 6.1-6.3).
• Knowledge of federal regulations and guidelines (FAR & DFAR) related to budgeting and program execution.
• Understanding of financial management and administrative support for government R&D programs.
• Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and related presentation development software.

Desired Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Business or Accounting.
• Three (3) years of federal grant management experience, preferably with the Department of Navy or Defense.
• Three (3) years of experience with Navy ERP or similar DoD accounting software.

Pay Range: $80,000.00 - $90,000.00

job_title: Senior Manager, ERP Risk, Governance & Compliance
description:
Transform Your Career

We deliver unparalleled opportunities for growth and career advancement. Our dynamic, entrepreneurial culture supports your journey every step of the way.

Embrace new challenges and deliver real value to some of the world's most influential Fortune 100 brands, growth companies transforming their industries, and mid-market firms that need help navigating the defining moments of their lifecycle. Work side by side with business leaders to solve complex client challenges and make a true impact. Love what you do as part of a diverse organization committed to collaboration and continuous learning.

The Team: Risk & Regulatory - ERP Governance, Risk, Compliance (GRC) & Internal Control Automation Solutions

Our team is comprised of a powerful mix of seasoned professionals with public accounting experience and business consultants with a deep expertise in a broad range of industries and focus areas. We take a comprehensive approach to help clients navigate through internal audit, risk, and compliance activities. We work as a broader team to address a wide range of business needs across the organization.

Your Impact

Provide ERP, automation, AI and data analytics support to clients of our growing Risk and Regulatory practice. Serve in a client-facing and field team leader role by leading defined work streams focused on IT risk and automation. Activities include:
• Lead risk advisory engagements from beginning to end, including planning, execution, reporting, and supervision of consultants.
• Apply current knowledge of IT trends, techniques, and risks to identify technology enabled opportunities to enhance value to our clients.
• Identify internal controls issues within our clients' ERP environment and design and implement solutions to mitigate risk.
• Develop understanding of core ERP processes and look for opportunities to help management in gaining process efficiencies and control optimization.
• Summarize and document results of ERP internal controls testing for management reporting including proper disposition of test exceptions.
• Assist clients redesign and transform their ERP risk management and related technical controls to achieve their compliance goals.
• Contribute to the growth of the risk advisory team to achieve key goals and initiatives.
• Develop thought leadership materials.
• Participate in business development activities.
• Actively participate in career development activities and technical training of staff.
• Document and perform analysis of client environment including technology strategy, current technology architecture, organizational structure, and business processes.
• Develop strategies and recommendations for technology-enabled solutions including key aspects of architecture, migration and security.
• Responsible for the analysis, design and implementation of automation solutions.
• Support the development of an Automation Center of Excellence to align client's strategic priorities, develop performance/risk reporting, and support the transition to a new service delivery model (e.g. Agile).
• Develop automation solutions across various platforms

What Do You Need to Succeed?

Minimum Qualifications:
• 8+ years of ERP, automation and data analytics experience in professional services and/or specific relevant internal audit industry experience.
• Public accounting firm experience.
• CISA, CISSP, or other applicable certification.
• Knowledge of ERP security and control leading practices to provide clients effective and practical recommendations.
• Hands-on experience with one or more "low code" RPA, AI and/or data analytic tools and techniques.
• Subject Matter Expertise on select ERP applications such as SAP, Oracle Cloud, NetSuite or Workday.
• Ability to lead workshops, including the gathering/documenting of requirements and use-cases and recommendation of envisioned processes.
• Understanding of typical software development lifecycles (Waterfall and Agile) and their associated lifecycle artifacts.
• Experience with identifying and correcting problems in imperfect data and processes.
• Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Management Information Systems or a related field.
• Must be flexible for travel.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience architecting and developing AI/ML solutions.
• Experience programming in Python, SQL, and/or R.
• Significant experience and/or Certification Alteryx, PowerBi and UiPath.
• ERP security assessment and/or design and implementation experience.
• Experience with the design and implementation of ERP GRC tools and related processes.

• Work with internal stakeholders to drive efficiency, quality, and accuracy of ERP master data.
• Continuously assess product data through the usage of exception reports to ensure ERP data quality and integrity, root causing any issues and communicating with all relevant departments.

• Provide ERP training/support for production, inventory and QC team members

• Support the implementation of our manufacturing processes and systems and collaborate with Facility Leadership to support kitchen operations and corresponding requirements.
• Generate reports to help Facility Leadership make informed decisions.
• Ensure data accuracy and compliance with food safety regulations within the ERP environment.
• Become a subject matter expert on the ERP system, understanding its configurations, modules, and best practices.
• Maintain comprehensive knowledge of, and ensure compliance with, relevant regulatory rules and standards, including Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), US Department of Agriculture (USDA), State Department of Agriculture, Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point (HACCP), Food Safety and Modernization Act (FSMA), Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), Department of Labor, Health and Sanitation regulations, Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and Weights and Measures.
• Establish and maintain collaborative and productive working relationships with Store Support teams and Operational Areas supported by Facility Leadership.
• Foster a positive work environment of outstanding teamwork and mutual respect.

• BA/BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field OR equivalent combination of education and ERP experience within a food manufacturing facility.
• 18+ months experience within a food production environment and 6+ months of supervisory experience in the food manufacturing industry.
• Strong understanding of Sage X3 ERP system or similar ERP systems, including finance, inventory management, procurement, and production planning modules.
• Hands-on experience with ERP implementation, customization, and maintenance is highly valued.
• Knowledge of Power BI is a plus.
• Basic understanding of manufacturing operations, supply chain management, environmental health and safety, and OSHA.
• Strong computer skills; proficiency in select Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint); and ability to learn custom applications.
• Understanding of financials and Profit & Loss (P&L) statements.
• Ability to work well with others, self-motivated, and capable of working independently with little supervision.
• Ability to work a flexible schedule based on the needs of the facility, including nights, weekends and holidays as required.
• Ability to build strong partnerships with key stakeholders.
• A genuine passion for food and a deep commitment to our purpose to nourish people and the planet.

• Must adhere to company dress code, standards of production kitchen dress, and personal protective equipment (PPE).
• Must be able to perform the essential functions of the job with reasonable accommodation.
• Hand use: single grasping, fine manipulation, pushing and pulling.
• Work requires the following motions: bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching.
• Exposure to FDA-approved cleaning chemicals.
• Exposure to temperatures: <32 degrees Fahrenheit (freezing), 32-40 degrees Fahrenheit (refrigerators), >90 degrees Fahrenheit.
• Ability to work in wet and dry conditions.

description:
Overview

Susquehanna is hiring a project manager to oversee the end-to-end execution of a replacement global ERP solution. This role requires an independent leader with a strong background in requirement gathering and documentation, the ability to manage cross-functional teams and external vendors, and a keen focus on technical integrations and resource optimization. They will work closely with Susquehanna’s internal technology team and stakeholders to determine the best solution for the current and future needs of the firm.

In this role, you will:
• Lead the successful implementation of the ERP system, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and timelines.
• Foster collaboration across business leaders in Accounting, Finance, Tax, Purchasing and Procurement, ensuring all stakeholder needs are addressed and aligned with project goals.
• Work closely with internal technology teams to ensure the seamless integration of the ERP with other enterprise systems, ensuring data integrity and compatibility.
• Assist with the configuration and testing of systems.
• Lead and manage project scope, risks, and timelines in collaboration with various teams.
• Provide training and support to end users on new financial systems and processes.

What you can expect from us:

Real Impact: You’ll be maintaining, designing and optimizing monitoring for an environment that process massive amounts of data, ensuring high performance and stability. You’ll see how your contributions work towards developing and supporting leading-edge solutions make a firm-wide impact that makes us all smarter, faster, and better.
Exposure to a variety of tech: At Susquehanna we use a diverse set of technologies intended to best address each area of demand. You will have the opportunity to gain knowledge and hands-on experience across our infrastructure through project work which may include 3rd party software, open source systems, and custom solutions. During these projects you will partner with senior engineers and key stakeholders across a wide range of potential projects.
Collaboration: Our systems engineers, network architects, technical analysts and software developers work together to create competitive edge through best-in-class technical solutions.
Growth: For many of our roles, we don’t expect you to have prior industry experience in proprietary trading or financial services to succeed at Susquehanna International Group. We’re looking for people who are naturally curious, relentless problem solvers, and have the desire to continuously innovate, learn, and grow.
Benefits: Susquehanna offers a wide array of competitive employee perks & benefits.

What we're looking for
• Experience in managing and implementing global financial IT systems projects, preferably with multiple ERP offerings.
• Strong techno-financial functional skills with a good understanding of end-to-end business processes
• Proven ability to manage complex technical integrations and large-scale IT projects.
• Great interpersonal skills and the ability to work well as part of a team or independently
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Excellent time management and organizational skills
• Prior experience supporting accounting users in technical role or working within an accounting role a strong plus
• Prior experience with Microsoft Dynamics GP a plus
• Visa sponsorship for work authorization is not available for this position now or in the future.

About Susquehanna

Susquehanna is a global quantitative trading firm founded by a group of friends who share a passion for game theory and probabilistic thinking. We have incorporated this approach into our culture, where you will find relentless problem solvers within each of our core disciplines: Trading, Technology, and Quantitative Research. From offices around the world, our employees collaborate to make optimal decisions and are driven by the desire to achieve winning results together.

‌

What we do

We are experts in trading essentially all listed financial products and asset classes, with a focus on derivatives trading. Through market making and market taking, we handle millions of trading transactions around the world every day, providing liquidity and ensuring competitive prices for buyers and sellers. While our presence in the market is broad, our trading desks are highly specialized, allowing for a deep understanding of unique drivers of each asset class.

Feel Good About Doing Good

The Knights of Columbus is a tax-exempt Catholic fraternal benefit society that provides financial security to members and their families through our life insurance, long-term care insurance, disability income insurance, investment and annuity products. Charity is at the core of our missions: our profits are donated to help those in need and to support our faith - $1.73B over the past ten years.

While we have many employees who are not Catholic, we follow the Church’s teachings in our investment strategies and our employee benefits. As part of our religious mission, we support the pro-life cause by contributing to the March for Life and pregnancy resource centers, we oppose assisted suicide and euthanasia, we are evangelists for the Catholic faith, and we help Christians who are facing religious persecution in the Middle East. We all work together to support our two million members as they volunteer to help others in their parishes and communities around the world.

Share Your Talent. Live Your Purpose.

We are a growing and purpose-driven community of professionals. Join us to discover how you can meet your goals and ours!

#LI-Hybrid

Overview

The Sr. ERP Engineer is a lead position in the development of the organization’s ERP technologies working with both internal resources and managed third parties. The Sr. ERP Engineer will create, modify, test and develop and enhance code, forms, script, and modules of the company's ERP software solutions based on customer requirements and business specifications. This includes installing, configuring, patching, upgrading, and maintaining the company’s investments in ERP technologies. The Sr. ERP Engineer will collaborate with architecture, other development teams, the business community, and with third party services. This role shall contribute to strengthening the business processes, performing both technical analysis and systems support activities.

Core Responsibilities
• Design, develop, and implement quality solutions across the application landscape that are maintainable, leveraging reuse as appropriate. Act as a primary advocate for the appropriate use of development, customization, and related best practices.
• Collaborate with SAP Business Stakeholders to identify, design, and implement internal process improvements such as automating manual processes and optimizing development processes.
• Develop Proof of Concepts (PoCs) to test new functionalities.
• Provide support in the areas of requirement gathering, business process mapping, solution design, data conversions, system configurations, testing, deployment, cutover coordination, training, and post go live support.
• Author functional and technical specifications at the level required for off-site technical development.
• Ensure all new developments conform to standards, and ensure the standards are kept up to date including interfacing with third party development and support on these items.
• Lead and perform technical mapping, gap analysis, and recommend the best way to address the gaps.
• Ensure the modules supported and their integration points with other systems and modules are aligned with the SAP road map.
• Participate in business case creation and estimation of work.
• Prioritize incidents and requests according to business needs.
• Recommend and implement best practices for KofC.

Skills Qualifications
• Must be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously with the ability to work well under pressure.
• Must be self-motivated, and able to work independently, as well as interact well with others and communicate professionally with people at all levels.
• Must demonstrate up-to-date expertise of the SAP ERP platform including S/4HANA (Core Finance, FSCD, FPSL, Treasury), SAP Analytics Cloud (Budgeting,Planning and reporting), Access Management (GRC), and SuccessFactors (employee central, recruitment, onboarding, compensation/variable pay, performance & goal management, succession management), Benefit Focus, and Concur.
• Familiar with SAP RISE and Solution Manager
• SAP S/4HANA Implementation experience
• At least 8 years of SAP Development skills
• Programming experience in SAP S/4HANA
• Experience developing FIORI apps.
• Experience writing outbound/inbound ABAP interfaces.
• Experience with SAP Basis/Infrastructure and SAP application security

Education

Required:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, engineering or relevant field.
• 8+ years hands on SAP ERP engineer experience.
• 8+ years IT experience.
• Strong problem-solving skills -- must be able to think critically and independently.

Preferred:
• SAP Certification

Compensation

The wage range for this role takes into account a broad array of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The range below applies as long as the work is performed in Connecticut; the Knights of Columbus reserves the right to adjust the wage range if the position is performed in another location. At the Knights of Columbus, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $104,500 - $172,400.

Authorization to work in the United States is required.

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Physical Demands

Must be able to remain in a stationary position for a majority of the workday.

KofC Cares

Our mission is focused on family and faith, and we support our employees in seeking a balanced life.

Employee benefits include:

Time Away: 13 paid holidays per year in addition to vacation and paid sick leave, and flexible workweek schedules.

Professional Development: Certifications, designation, and tuition reimbursement.

Retirement Benefits: 401(k) retirement savings plan with matching company contributions, and cash balance retirement plans fully funded by the company.

Health and Wellness:
• Short-term disability and term life insurance fully paid for by the company;
• Up to 12 weeks of childbirth leave under STD policy.
• One week of fully paid parental leave for all new parents, including adoptive and foster parents.
• A variety of health insurance options, including premium-level family coverage and a pre-tax Health Savings Account with employer contributions. The Order's health plans do not cover abortion, sterilization, or contraception, and the Order has helped advocate for other employers who do not want to provide coverage.
• Long-term disability insurance;
• Dental insurance;
• Vision insurance;
• Health club membership reimbursement;
• Employee Assistance Program

Ellucian is a global market leader in education technology. We power innovation for higher education, partnering with more than 2,900 customers across 50 countries and serving over 20 million students. Ellucian's AI-powered platform, trained on the richest dataset available in higher education, drives efficiency, personalized experiences, and strengthened engagement for all students, faculty and staff. Fueled by decades of experience with a singular focus on the unique needs of learning institutions, the Ellucian platform features best-in-class SaaS capabilities and delivers insights needed now and into the future. These solutions and services span the entire student lifecycle, from student recruitment, enrollment, and retention to workforce analytics, fundraising, and alumni engagement. Ellucian's innovative solutions, vast ecosystem of partners, and user community of more than 45,000 provide best practices leading to greater institutional success and achieving better student outcomes.

Values Rooted in Purpose

We embrace the power to lead, the courage to innovate, and the determination to grow. At our core, we believe in humanizing our approach, recognizing that our people are our greatest strength. With a shared vision of transformation, we endeavor to shape a brighter future for higher education.

About the Opportunity

Our Professional Services team at Ellucian is seeking a Solutions Architect who will play a key role in shaping the vision and architecture of our solutions across multiple Ellucian products. This role is focused on designing, supporting, and implementing best practice solutions throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring alignment with customer business goals and requirements. The Solutions Architect will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams during the presales cycle, lead Cloud/SaaS modernization engagements, and drive outcomes-based methodology practices to accelerate time-to-value for higher education institutions. Reporting directly to the manager of the practice, the Solutions Architect will serve as a thought leader and principal liaison, ensuring the successful delivery of solutions as architected.

What you will bring

• Technical Background: Comfortable with and have past experience in technical implementation, with the ability to architect multiple functional and technical areas.
• Preferred experience with higher education delivery in large scale ERP platforms.

• Ability to articulate value and ROI for customers around a variety of software and services solutions.

description:
Job Description

Grow your career at Cedars-Sinai!

The Enterprise Information Services (EIS) team at Cedars-Sinai understands that true clinical transformation and the optimization of a clinical information systems implementation is fueled through the alignment of the right people, processes, and technologies.

Why work here?

Cedars-Sinai placed in the top 20 on Newsweek’s “World's Best Smart Hospitals 2024” list, which highlights hospitals that have excelled in the utilization of electronic functionalities, telemedicine, digital imaging, artificial intelligence and robotics.

The organization’s Healthtech excellence was acknowledged again, this time by the esteemed “CHIME Digital Health Most Wired“ recognition program. Cedars-Sinai was assigned a Level 10—the most prestigious level of certification—among more than 300 surveyed healthcare organizations. Cedars-Sinai netted high scores across multiple verticals and particularly excelled in areas of infrastructure, interoperability, and population health innovation.

What will you be doing in this role:

The ERP Project Manager is responsible for coordinating all phases and activities vital to implement various ERP initiatives: system requirements definition, process and/or workflow redesign, vendor evaluation, and contract negotiation (if applicable), implementation coordination with operations and other EIS departments, as well as transition to support functions. The ERP Project Manager works closely with operational and IT stakeholders to ensure project alignment with organizational goals, compliance requirements and continuous improvement initiatives.
• Responsible for crafting and leading all aspects of detailed project budgets and timelines, progress updates, project slide decks, and blocking issues. Provide project management expertise for an entire project life cycle. Ensures contract compliance, risk analysis, project scope, implementation management, and support transition.
• Coordinate communication between all project team members and operational partners, ensure vendor responsiveness and compliance with the terms of the contract (if applicable), and coordinate initial user training/transition to an ongoing user support group.
• Ensure ERP initiatives align with business needs, compliance requirements, and EIS capabilities.
• Drive continuous improvement and automation to streamline operations and reduce manual efforts.
• Build and sustain strong working relationships with operational partners, taking ownership of issue resolution and ensuring successful outcomes.
• Multi-functional Project Execution – Improve resource planning, risk management, and critical metric tracking to ensure successful ERP adoption.
• Forecast resource requirements, ensuring appropriate assignment of resources to each project/support phase, adding and removing resources as vital, and have overall responsibility for completion of projects. Lead and manage projects within established time and budget parameters.
• Deliver informative and timely status reports using department reporting procedures for both internal EIS and external operational customers.
• Keep abreast of current trend and developments in Oracle Cloud and ERP through participation with vendor user groups, attend conferences, vendor demonstrations, and interacting with other vendor customers. Maintain a solid grasp of system development and project management methodologies.

This remote position is approved for workers in the following states only: Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Minnesota, Nevada, Oregon, and Texas.

Qualifications

Experience Requirements:

One (1) year plus of experience leading IT projects, ideally ERP-related, within a healthcare or similarly complex environment.

Solid understanding of Oracle Cloud ERP, including Finance, Supply Chain, HR, and Payroll modules.

Experience with UKG Timekeeping and Scheduling or similar systems.

Background in healthcare IT project management is highly desirable.

Educational/Certification Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Healthcare, Management, Business or related field.

PMP (Project Management Professional) preferred.

Senior ERP Consultant – IFS Cloud Implementation (9-12 Month Engagement)

Job Description:
We are seeking two Senior ERP Consultants to support a large-scale IFS Cloud ERP implementation. This will be a long-term contract (9-12 months), working closely with our team and the client to ensure a smooth and successful ERP deployment.

The ideal candidates are seasoned ERP professionals with deep experience in IFS Cloud, strong client-facing skills, and the ability to guide business and technical teams through the implementation process.

Key Responsibilities:

✅ Lead functional and technical implementation efforts for IFS Cloud
✅ Work directly with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into ERP solutions
✅ Configure, customize, and optimize IFS Cloud modules based on project requirements
✅ Provide hands-on problem-solving and troubleshooting for ERP-related issues
✅ Conduct system testing, validation, and end-user training
✅ Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, finance, and operations
✅ Ensure smooth data migration, system integration, and post-go-live support

Ideal Candidate:
• 8+ years of ERP implementation experience, with at least 3+ years specific to IFS Cloud
• Strong background in business process mapping, configuration, and deployment
• Experience with ERP data migration, integrations, and customizations
• Client-facing and customer service-oriented mindset – excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
• Ability to work independently and proactively solve problems in a fast-paced environment
• Prior consulting or professional services experience preferred

Project Details:
• Duration: 9-12 months (full-time or near full-time commitment)
• Remote with occasional on-site meetings (TBD based on project needs)
• Competitive hourly rate based on experience

This is an exciting opportunity to work on a high-impact ERP project with a dynamic team. If you are an experienced IFS Cloud consultant who thrives in a collaborative, client-facing role, we’d love to hear from you!

Please answer these questions in your cover letter:
• What is your desired hourly rate for this role?
• Do you have experience with ERP data migration, integrations, and customizations?

• 3 full lifecycle ERP system implementations (e.g. SAP ECC, SAP RISE, Oracle Fusion Cloud).

• Lead technology workstream for a merger or carveout in a moderate-to-high complexity transaction.
• Experience managing client relationships in a consulting firm environment.
• Global technology transformation experience; leading complex engagements and managing teams of 3-10 members.
• Experience in SAP or Oracle ERP.
• Experience in LeanIX or similar Enterprise Architecture tools is a plus.
• Expert program manager with extensive experience managing multiple projects including developing work plans, project scopes, pricing estimates, budget management, issue and risk management, and presenting deliverables.
• Business development experience including farming leads and assisting in managing the sales process – pursuit strategy, client development cycle and tools, proposal development, fee and profitability planning, and contract management.
• Strong data visualization and analysis skills; experience in financial analytics and models; highly proficient using tools like Excel to analyze data and present key insights in a compelling way.
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills including the ability to create impactful and concise executive stakeholder-ready deliverables, and polished client-facing oral communication skills.

• Ability to work permanently in the United States without sponsorship.
• A commitment to inclusion and diversity, and openness to new ideas and perspectives.

Life Science ERP Global Key User (GKU) for GPO Master Data

The Global Key User (GKU) for Master Data plays a key role in the Sustain & Enhance (S&E) organization supporting the LS ERP in Global Plant Operations (GPO). The S&E Team will support the implementation of legacy ERP systems into the organization, support enhancement requests to improve the system, and work closely with the IT, master data and other teams to resolve high priority issues and drive continuous improvement.
As an expert of the manufacturing master data you will be a key role in improving master data quality for the GPO network within projects and improvement initiatives in close collaboration with local sites and cross-functional partners. GKUs will act as a link between local business and global activities. GKUs act as promoter and key knowledge resource of the global template across all project milestones and act as an escalation path for ERP projects and issues. The role requires strong leadership and high communication capabilities. If you are passionate about driving operational excellence & have a proven track record in change management and project execution, this is the opportunity for you to make a significant impact and grow your career.

Competencies and job specific skills:
• Knowledge in master data in support of Manufacturing (Production, Quality Control, Plant Maintenance)
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze highly complex business processes
• Ability to simplify complex information into clear, actionable insights
• Effective communication skills to work closely with various stakeholders and ensure alignment
• Experience in change management, ensuring smooth transitions and minimal disruption during process changes
• Ability to manage multiple projects & tasks simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail
• Previous involvement in initiatives that required the design or definition of business processes/scenarios, value streams, identification of issues, etc.
• Experience in project management, including planning, execution, and stakeholder management

Key responsibilities:
• Working closely with process experts in production, quality control, plant maintenance and warehouse management in supporting sites on improving data quality in a sustainable way
• Co-leading deployment of Data Governance Framework for GPO across sites in close collaboration with ONE ERP Manufacturing Master data expert
• Developing and deploy master data audits throughout the network
• Define, align and implement approach for master data support for legacy ERPs in close alignment with ONE ERP and Standard Plant Architecture (SPA)
• Supporting Data transformation from legacy into future state
• Improving documentation and training materials for GPO-owned master data

Position is remote within the US or Europe with Travel up to 20%

Minimum Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree in Economics, Engineering, Science or similar discipline
• At least 5 years of experience with Material Master Data supporting Manufacturing processes or a related field
• At least 2 years of experience working with ERP systems, preferably SAP systems within the Life Sciences industry
• An understanding on how relational databases work
• Fluent in English, with additional foreign language such as German beneficial

Preferred Requirements:
• Experience with ERP system design
• Experience in supporting and liaising in a multicultural, global work environment
• Experience with SAP MDG
• Use tools like UPTIMIZE/MS Access to continually audit Master Data based on validation rules and provide error reports
• Excellent communication and presentation skills, problem-solving strength and process thinking
• Empowering team player with a proactive, self-motivated work approach with a passion for business processes

This position is remote flexible within the US or Europe and requires travel (domestic and international) of up 20% annually.

Kenyon College is seeking applications for an ERP Programmer Analyst in the Information Technology (IT) department. This is a full time position eligible for benefits, limited to a term of five years (August 2025 through June 2030).

About Us: Join our Team!

Kenyon College, one of the nation’s finest liberal arts colleges, is a small school where academic excellence and a strong sense of community go hand in hand. Kenyon’s beautiful hilltop campus is located in Gambier, OH, 45 miles northeast of Columbus, OH. Kenyon enrolls 1800 undergraduate students, all of whom live on campus the entire time they are students at Kenyon.

The Information Technology (IT) department is an inclusive group committed to ensuring all students, faculty, staff, alumni, and other campus partners have a safe, productive, enjoyable, and meaningful experience with college technology. We provide creative solutions, responsive services, and reliable, secure access to an enabling infrastructure. The IT team is an encouraging environment where we grow, learn, and pursue our craft. We are helpful, kind, friendly, and respectful of all. We enjoy a sense of humor--something we find essential to our success. We make our work fun whenever possible! Work/life balance is valued here: we love our work but understand that there is more to life. Professional development and diversity are also valued here: we continually learn new skills, grow in our understanding of the world around us, and explore new technologies.

About the Position: Do Work that Matters!

Are you a versatile IT professional with a knack for tackling a wide range of technical challenges? If you're adept at managing complex systems, diving into server logs, and assisting partners with innovative solutions, we invite you to join our team.

The ERP Programmer Analyst reports to the Director for Institutional Data Systems and primarily supports the college’s enterprise data system, Ellucian Banner, and its data integrations. The ERP Programmer Analyst will interact regularly with other departments to support the mission of the College, collaborating extensively with other members of the IT team.

The major functional areas for the ERP Programmer Analyst includes database and server management, integration and analysis. The ERP Programmer Analyst supports the ERP system used for Finance, Human Resources, and Academics. The ERP Programmer Analyst also creates and maintains custom system integrations that connect and synchronize data between the enterprise software system and performs the detailed analysis needed to implement these integrations effectively across a combination of campus and cloud infrastructure.

IT team members are encouraged and expected to develop and grow their skills to match the needs of the institution, and to help others grow, too. Recognizing that technology is continually changing, the ERP Programmer Analyst participates in regular professional development and in the larger professional community as well.

Minimum Requirements:

We value both education and experience. A successful candidate should be comfortable with technology, be curious, and love to learn. These are the minimum requirements for a successful candidate:
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field or a combination of relevant education and experience. Effective written and verbal communication skills. Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills.

Preferred Qualifications

These are the preferred qualifications for a successful candidate:
• Three (3) years of professional experience with management, operation, and support of computing systems, preferably within a higher education environment. Experience with Higher Education ERP Systems, specifically Ellucian Banner: Student, Finance and Human Resource (HR) modules. Knowledge of or experience with common programming languages and ability to utilize APIs. Knowledge of database and application upgrades and testing. Knowledge of SQL programming - design, coding and testing. Knowledge of scripting languages - Python, PowerShell, Perl, etc. Knowledge of Oracle DBMS and Microsoft SQL Server DBMS database administration. Knowledge of Windows server and Linux server operating systems . Experience with authentication and authorization.

Working Conditions:

Kenyon is an employer that understands the complexity of modern life. Our IT team works flexible hours and can function in a hybrid environment.

Application Process:
• Applicants should submit a cover letter and a resume.

For full consideration, please submit your materials by June 20th, 2025.

Compensation and Benefits:

Salaries at Kenyon are competitive and commensurate with experience. In addition to an attractive salary, Kenyon offers excellent benefits for employees and their family members. Children of employees are eligible for 100% tuition waivers at Kenyon, and through the Great Lakes Colleges Association, children of employees are eligible for 90% tuition waivers at nineteen other of the nation's finest liberal arts colleges.

We also offer health, dental and vision insurance, TIAA retirement, and many other benefits, including provisions for a spouse, families, and domestic partners. Details about benefits as well as conditions of employment are described more fully in our Staff Handbook.

Kenyon is a unique place to live and work. To discover why it should be your next home, click here.

Kenyon College is an equal opportunity employer and applications from members of all underrepresented groups are encouraged. It is the College's policy to evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, physical and/or mental disability, age, religion, medical condition, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by institutional policy or state, local, or federal law. Kenyon College has a strong commitment to supporting diversity, equity and inclusion. Please visit our Diversity at Kenyon website.

The CGI Government Cloud Services Program (GCS) delivers and supports a proprietary Government Advantage ERP software suite, and we are expanding our client base rapidly.

Our CGI Government Solutions group is seeking skilled ERP Applications Engineers that will work directly with multiple clients in this large-scale, globally supported outsourcing and premium maintenance program based in Lafayette, LA. For this role, CGI is looking for an individual with experience working on enterprise-scale, multi-tiered, multi-platform, integrated systems; excellent problem-solving skills; a good work ethic that takes full ownership of the teams workload; a shown history of driving teams to meet target dates and being very responsive to requests for assistance; and the ability to optimally work with other geographically distributed team members and other teams.

Requisition Number: 69437

The company built on breakthroughs.
Join us.

Corning is one of the world's leading innovators in glass, ceramic, and materials science. From the depths of the ocean to the farthest reaches of space, our technologies push the boundaries of what's possible.

How do we do this? With our people. They break through limitations and expectations- not once in a career, but every day. They help move our company,and the world, forward.

At Corning, there are endless possibilities for making an impact. You can help connect the unconnected, drive the future of automobiles, transform at-home entertainment, and ensure the delivery of lifesaving medicines. And so much more.

Come break through with us.

Corning's businesses are ever evolving to best serve our customers, industries, and consumers. Today, we accelerate and transform life sciences, mobile consumer electronics, optical communications, display, and automotive markets. We are changing the world with:
• Trusted products that accelerate drug discovery, development, and delivery to save lives
• Damage-resistant cover glass to enhance the devices that keep us connected
• Optical fiber, wireless technologies, and connectivity solutions to carry information and ideas at the speed of light
• Precision glass for advanced displays to deliver richer experiences
• Auto glass and ceramics to drive cleaner, safer, and smarter transportation
Role Purpose

This position will be instrumental in enabling and supporting the implementation of a new plant-wide ERP (Enterprise Resource Management) and support of the existing and future Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) aimed at bringing a growing plant from legacy, independent manufacturing systems to a robust, common systems platform across all plant businesses.

This position will have responsibility for Plant MES administration, providing overall leadership for its proper use, maintenance, upgrades, etc. ensuring alignment with the ERP system

Key Responsibilities
• Work as key member of cross-functional project team to ensure MES system requirements are properly defined, designed, tested, and implemented.
• Cross-functional team includes: corporate system developers, business and IT program managers, plant manufacturing department leaders, process engineers, and hourly workforce leaders and associates.
• Learn from experts regarding fundamentals of system interface design; apply to later functionality as implementation team moves on and database evolution falls under purview of the plant
• Provide overall long-term direction for proper use of ERP / MES, maintenance, upgrades, etc.
• Monitor daily ERP/MES error log and responsibility for troubleshooting and fixing errors in ERP/MES systems with the goal of determining root cause to ensure permanent corrective actions are put in place
• Ensure alignment of ERP master data between the 2 systems (MES & ERP) such as workflows and routers, production orders (status, quantities, dates, etc.), and master data like material tolerances
• Champion MES needs to make manufacturing more efficient
• Provide manufacturing with key reporting and data required to manufacture parts and track performance

Experiences/Education - Required
• 2-year degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Software Development, Engineering or technical degree and/or similar skills and experiences with IT systems / software in a manufacturing environment
• 3-5 years in manufacturing or technical field
• Ability to harvest data from multiple data sources and turn into informative spreadsheet, manufacturing report, or other tool that captures the essence of a manufacturing process in a meaningful, informative way
• Enjoys spending time on manufacturing floor interfacing with hourly workforce working to understand details of their daily challenges and working to create solutions that result in efficiency gains
• Works collaboratively in a diverse team environment, possesses robust written and communication skills, can communicate effectively across numerous groups (project team, manufacturing floor, plant leadership, etc.), and enjoys building strong relationships
• Experience with data visualization via Power BI and SharePoint
• Hands-on project experience with demonstrated success
• Experience harvesting data from multiple data stores via SQL or other
• Strong desire to learn and grow in areas needed for the position that they may not know starting out

Experiences/Education - Desired
• Advanced spreadsheet skills
• Experience managing and supporting databases such as Microsoft SQL
• Experience creating custom reports in Microsoft SSRS
• Programming skills, including .NET, C#
• Familiarity with OSI PI and OPC
• Experience with Camstar and SAP

• Getting paid for our work is important but feeling appreciated and recognized for those contributions motivates us much more. That's why Corning offers a peer-to-peer recognition program to celebrate success by recognizing colleagues who demonstrate above-and-beyond behaviors.

job_title: Analista de Datos y Operaciones de Ventas
description:
Responsabilidades clave:

Gestión de datos y supervisión del flujo de trabajo
• Poseer y gestionar el flujo diario de datos operativos y de ventas de múltiples fuentes, incluidos sistemas ERP, hojas de cálculo e importaciones externas.
• Limpie, estructure y fusione conjuntos de datos para garantizar la coherencia, la confiabilidad y la facilidad de uso en todos los departamentos.
• Mantenga la integridad de los datos y garantice actualizaciones oportunas en todas las plataformas, acompañadas de una documentación exhaustiva de los procesos de datos.

Generación de conocimiento y soporte analítico
• Analizar periódicamente datos de importaciones, ventas y proveedores para identificar anomalías, tendencias, inconsistencias y oportunidades comerciales.
• Aprovechar los datos del comercio mundial y los indicadores macroeconómicos para fundamentar las previsiones y estrategias internas.
• Realizar análisis en profundidad de las tendencias del mercado global y los patrones de importación/exportación para respaldar la planificación estratégica y la toma de decisiones.

Control de Ventas y Análisis Comercial
• Supervisar las métricas de desempeño de ventas, las estrategias de precios y el flujo de pedidos para respaldar las funciones de control comercial.
• Garantizar informes precisos sobre los KPI de ventas, proporcionando información útil a los líderes de ventas y a las partes interesadas ejecutivas.
• Apoyar el desarrollo y la aplicación de los procesos de gobernanza de ventas.

Informes y automatización
• Cree y mantenga plantillas y herramientas automatizadas en Excel, Python, Power BI o Tableau para optimizar las tareas de informes recurrentes.
• Ayudar a crear paneles e informes personalizados para mejorar la visibilidad entre los equipos comerciales, logísticos y financieros.
• Apoyar los ciclos de informes semanales y mensuales, garantizando que la información basada en datos se entregue de forma clara y eficaz.

Colaboración y asociación empresarial
• Trabaje en estrecha colaboración con los equipos de gestión para traducir las preguntas comerciales en recomendaciones basadas en datos.
• Brindar soporte continuo para solicitudes de datos ad hoc y proyectos estratégicos en equipos multifuncionales.

Requisitos:
• Sólidas habilidades en Excel (tablas dinámicas, búsquedas, validación de datos, automatización mediante fórmulas/macros).
• Confianza y rapidez en la manipulación de datos utilizando Python (pandas) o SQL.
• Orientado a los detalles, metódico y confiable: prospera en un entorno de rápido movimiento.
• Excelente comunicador: capaz de explicar los datos con claridad a partes interesadas sin conocimientos técnicos.
• Experiencia con datos de importación/exportación, ventas o adquisiciones es una gran ventaja.
• El conocimiento de herramientas de BI como Power BI, Tableau o similares es una ventaja.
